intro: Ceratogonon, commonly known as the spiny cactus, is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and fleshy leaves. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with their succulent structures. Ceratogonon species produce small, showy flowers that bloom in various colors, often attracting pollinators like bees and birds.
